sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Foundation for Research in Health Systems
sourceOfFunds.purpose: This health needs assessment study in Majuli district of Assam was carried out to guide the development of an Integrated Health Care Delivery model (IHCD) being initiated by Piramal Swasthya in 100 villages, with the goal of reducing maternal and infant mortality as well as premature mortality due to Hypertension and Diabetes, through early detection, treatment and referral services.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Foundation for Research in Health Systems
sourceOfFunds.purpose: This project developed and validated case-vignettes and scoring format for top five maternal mortality and top five neonatal mortality causes in South-East Asia Region as well as modified and translated the self-assessment questionnaires for assessing midwifery competence among midwifery educators and professional midwives, and tested its regional adaptation for comprehensiveness and applicability.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Foundation for Research in Health Systems
sourceOfFunds.purpose: A study undertaken to form the roadmap for implementation of national midwifery guidelines (2019). ngoList.title: gaden shartse dokhang khangtsen Traditional Education Promotion society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Gaden shartse Dokang Khangtsen Traditional Education Promotion Society completed 4 year of service. The primary goal of the society is three fold preserve Culture, Education and Health. In the field of education, the centre strives to encompass both moral and modern Education through its work the centre work to instill traditional values like moral ethics, compassion and sense of other well â€“ being in the students to create a harmonious society. Besides the moral Education the society works provide the students modern education that acts as a backbone for an individual career as well as for the development of oneâ€™s family and his nation at large the modern Education includes the rich Buddhist Cultural heritage from the Himalayan belt, providing exposure to the modern outside world, introduction to various modern scientific Educations. Towards this ends, the society spends more than 80% of the financial aids from outside sources to provide facilities necessary or such Education to realize. Funds are mostly spent for facilities like construction of new improvement of existing school building class room, text books, and staffs salaries and so on. In providing the Education, it is paramount important to ensure the students are physically healthy due to this, we also invest our financial sources in the heath of Students by spending our funds in hospital and health care in initiatives. Observing Special days The society by virtue of its location in India observes and marks all important occasion of India apart from our own important dates including Indian RepublicDay,Buddha Shakyamuni Birth,Enlightment and Parinivana Day, Brithday of the his Holiness the Dalai Lama,The independence Day, Ghanti jayanti etc. Another important work that the society has done to promote religious harmony among different faith and also to promote harmonious relation between different sects within a religion. To realize that, the society observes all important dates of different religion holds introductory class to teach about Various traditions, conducts debate and discussions to promote the importance of harmonious existence between different faiths.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: In this regard, we Help Child India with a strong hope to nurture these little minds, which allow them to lay an academic foundation and bring the very best of their childhood, through our Pre-School located at Byrathi Village, Doddagubbi Post, Bengaluru. The Pre-School of ours is an initiative under program Education, which is an independent school which provides a safe and inducing environment to nurture and inspire young ones at free of cost. We understand that every child is unique individual and our objective is to bring out their potential through a joyful and dynamic learning environment. The features of our Pre-School are: â€¢ Completely free education for 30 students for ages 3-5 â€¢ Good infrastructure with calm and spacious area â€¢ Free nutritional support and personal care â€¢ Two teachers, one coordinator and two ayahs at the center â€¢ Playful learning environment With this we aim to create a school community that promotes a passion for learning and enable the child to reach his or her fullest potential with colors of success.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The program aims to open 60 Early Childhood Education Centres in 60 Villages in rural india. The centres will provide comprehensive Early Childhood Education to children in the age group 2.5 years to 6 years in these villages by providing age-appropriate activities and experience for holistic development of the child. The program is designed to be economically viable for the population its serves and is suited to the cultural extent of the child.
